dialogue.text: I guess I’ll give Kirin a call.
I’ve sort of been sitting on her number ever since she gave it to me, and she seems...normal enough to hang out with.
Okay, well, maybe 'normal' isn’t the right word.
If anything, she’s actually kind of abnormal.
But it’s the good kind of abnormal.
Like she's actually an evil spirit or something.
Wait, no. That's paranormal. Silly me.
What am I even talking about right now? I should just call her before she winds up doing something else.
I press on Kirin’s name in my contact menu and wait for her to pick up.
Hihi~ Whatcha up to, Sensei? Bored on your day off?
I guess so. Just looking for something to do.
Cool, cool.
Wanna come over?
Woah. Already?
Can I have chocolate milk if I do?
Uhhhhh...sure?
Did your parents and or roommates specifically say it was okay for me to drink their chocolate milk? Because I need to know for sure before I make any plans.
Nope! They’re not here much anyway.
And your sister?
Mmm...I think she’s out with Miku? I can’t really remember.
And she’s not planning on coming back any time soon?
What’s with all the questions? Do you wanna come over or not?
Sure. Where do you live?
Do you know where Pepper-Lunch is?
Pepper what?
Getting fired at your age probably isn’t going to look good on future applications.
Ehh, it’s whatever. That job was super boring anyway.
Just look up the address of that place and meet me there in like...half an hour. Kay?
I’ll walk you to my house and stuff.
Sure thing. See you then.
Byeeee~
After hanging up, I punch in the address to Pepper-Lunch in my phone and begin to make my way there...
I show up in front of the restaurant to find Kirin already waiting there.
She’s probably only been here for a few minutes anyway.
Kirin pulls herself off of the wall and skips over to me as I approach her.
Hey! Find the place okay?
It was easy enough.
Maybe a little confusing at first, but once I figured out the streets were numbered it was fine.
Well I’m glad you made it. I felt like I was gonna die if I had to sit around the stupid house all day.
Do you...not have any friends or something?
Of course I have friends...What is that supposed to mean?
I don’t know. I just figured that if you did, you’d be hanging out with them instead of, you know, a teacher.
I was actually thinking about texting a few of ‘em, but then I saw your number show up and was like “ehh, screw it.”
And now here we are, in front of the place that fired me for not showing up to one or two shifts.
Not to take sides here, but I’m pretty sure that’s a good reason to fire someone.
Yeah. I learned from my mistakes and am attempting to become a better person.
I'm very proud of you for being able to admit that, Kirin. That takes strength.
Are you, uhh, sure you’re ready to come over, though? I figured you’d be kinda hesitant after our talk in your office.
I know I didn't seem very enthused by the prospect of watching Seinfeld Season 3 back then, but I have thought more about it and am ready to give it a try.
Okay, but if you change your mind-
Just take me to your damn apartment, woman.
Bossing me around already? We’re not even alone yet, Sensei.
So it’s okay to boss you around once we {i}are{/i}?
Hehe~ Maybe not today. I’ve still gotta size you up and stuff.
Is there a height limit? Oh! Do you live on a rollercoaster?!
What? No. It’s a phrase.
Oh. I, uhh, think that might be a problem then. But I’ll do my best.
You don’t really have to do anything you normally wouldn’t. I mean like, we’ll be alone, so stuff might just happen naturally.
That’s how this sort of thing goes, right?
I just want to reiterate that I'm only here for chocolate milk.
Ohhhh. Is that so?...
Why do you look so pissed off now?
I’m not pissed off.
Just...follow me.
I’ll show you where the apartment is...
Kirin’s anger(?) winds up fading away just moments later.
From the sound of it, she’s lived in this same area her entire life.
I wonder what it is that turned her into who she is now?
Or, at least, what she seems to be.
The whole thing about not knowing her is sticking in my head a lot more than I thought it would...
I’m home~
Kirin calls out to absolutely no one and takes her shoes off, leaving them in the entryway.
I’d actually be rather impressed by the place if it wasn’t also the size of a large shoebox.
Does your entire family really live here?
Hm? Yeah. What do you mean?
I join Kirin, who’s already taken a seat on the couch, and continue on with my train of thought.
It just seems kind of small for four people. Do you and Karin share a room?
Technically, yeah. I normally just sleep on the couch, though.
You sleep on the couch in your own home?
Yeah. Karin talks in her sleep sometimes and it gets really weird.
She talks? About what?
Sports stuff, I guess? Nothing interesting or sexy or anything like that.
I see.
What? Boring answer? Did you think she might be saying stuff about you or something?
Not really, no. Was just hoping for something a little more entertaining.
Yeah. I can relate to that.
Life can get pretty boring sometimes, huh?
It’s not {i}that{/i} bad.
Says the guy with a harem of [high_school] girls.
Hey, I never wanted that. I just want to teach.
What do you have to be bored of, though? Isn’t this like, the prime of your life?
It’s supposed to be. I just feel like nothing ever happens around here anymore.
Yeah, the city’s closed off and stuff, but that’s not really what I’m talking about.
It’s like, everything I try doing I only do to be around other people. Nothing’s ever fun.
And so a lot of the time I just wind up sitting at home reading or like, donating money to charity or whatever.
Interesting. You didn’t really strike me as a reader.
Is that an insult?
No, of course not. There’s nothing wrong with reading.
That’s not what your face says...
Well I can’t see my face, so I’m no help there...but what kind of books are you into?
I see...
An awkward silence suddenly finds its way next to us on the couch, changing the air in the room for a brief moment in time.
I can’t tell if Kirin feels comfortable or uncomfortable. To me, she just seems weird.
Like she’s got some type of shell up that she’s trying to crack {i}and{/i} glue back together at the same time.
Hey.
Something’s been bugging me and I feel like I’m gonna get annoyed if I don’t ask you. Is that cool?
Sure. There aren’t many questions I have trouble answering. Sometimes, a window even pops up to help me choose.
A what now?
Nothing. Please just ask me your question.
Well, okay. But you have to be honest about it.
Sure.
Okay, so, uhhh-
How upset will you be if I tell you that one of my friends is actually borrowing my Seinfeld DVD right now?
You're really upset, aren't you?
Is that what you do to people, Kirin?
Invite people over just to cut them down?
Not...normally?
So I'm special?? I'M THE ONE WHO GETS TO HURT?!
I can't do this.
Wait. I have other DVDs. We can-
I'm going home to hug my accountant.
Have fun dancing all by yourself.
Sigh. Looks like I'm donating to another charity...
{i}Kirin’s affection has increased to [kirin_love]!{/i}
